SENT.plain: Malakoplakia is a rare chronic disease with pleomorphic presentations
It involves many organs, particularly the urinary and gastro-intestinal tracts
It is less common on the skin
Lesions result from impaired phagocytosis of bacteria by macrophages
Malakoplakia is sometimes related to immunodeficiencies
The diagnosis is usually made by histological examination
We report a case associated with a myelodysplastic syndrome
